review: This box is wonderful.  Impressive from the first minute, it got here in right away, the packaging is like opening a gift box.It set up in less than 10 minutes, super easy to use.  The instruction book tells you how to connect: connect one end of the HDMI cable to the tv, the other to the Fire TV box, plug in the power cord, and set the tv to the appropriate HDMI input (channel) and that's it.  Use the remote control to sign in to your wireless network - it can be a little confusing to figure out the key board commands, but that too takes seconds to figure out.  You can also connect with an Ethernet cable no need to have wireless internet, the only thing you really need is the HDMI connection on the television.There's a little intro video that explains how to use the control clearly, no frustrations, no need to call tech support.  The resolution and the sound are fantastic.  Huge selection, I can see anything I want when I want, favorite shows, stuff I missed, stuff I never heard of, no need to wait for a show time, or record anything.  It's all there.I can't see any reason to have cable or satellite television at this point.
author: harry57

review: All and all very pleased with this product. It does exactly what I wanted it to do (play Hulu, Netflix, and Youtube on my tv) without having to use a tablet, lap top or phone like the Chromecast does. My only complaint is that the voice commands don't work while searching in these apps, only to search Amazon content, but that is the fault of the app developers, not of Amazon.  Annoying, but not a big deal.I would kill for a key pad for this, as having to cycle back and forth across the entirety of the alphabet to type in searches is pretty painful.

review: I have been more than happy with my Fire TV since the moment I hooked it up, and it just keeps getting better. First, it is easily the best content streaming device I have had. I say that after using four different Blu-ray players--two from Samsung, one Sony, and my current Panasonic. All of those had limitations or problems that made them less useful than this unit. The constant upgrading is great and the new services just keep coming. Really was happy the other day when I found I could access my entire Amazon Cloud music library, and if that wasn't enough, I found last night that I could access all the photos and videos from my iPhone from Fire TV with an app. This summer, with the purchase of two after-market controllers my grandkids had hours of trouble-free enjoyment playing various games. If I didn't have so many DVD's I would be tempted to mothball all my Blu-ray players and get another Fire TV unit. Only one negative I can think of is not having access (so far) to VUDU. Other than that, I can't think of anything I have purchased in years that has been so trouble-free, so easy to use, and so flexible, with more and more features to come, I expect.
